Full API¶

Hotspot API v1.0 Nick Sweeting 2014

api.models.sortable(func)[source]¶

Takes any QuerySet-returning-function, orders output by sort_key=’‘, truncates to first records=# e.g. User.objects.get(id=1).checkins(records=3, sort_key=’time_in’)

class api.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

User(id, password, last_login, is_superuser, username, first_name, last_name, email, is_staff, is_active, date_joined, telephone)

User extends AbstractUser .

telephone = None¶

Field: Telephone Number. Defaults to None.

checkin(self, hotspot, time_in=timezone.now(), time_out=epoch)[source]¶

Checks the user into Hotspot at time_in= timezone.now(), setting time_out to the unix epoch (indicating user is still checked in)

checkout(self, checkin=None, business=None, hotspot=None, time_out=timezone.now())[source]¶
Checks user out of checkin= CheckIn at time_out= timezone.now()
if checkin=None, checks out from all checkins where business= Business and/or hotspot= Hotspot
checkins(self, business=None, hotspot=None, records=0, sort_key="")[source]¶

Returns QuerySet of CheckIn objects where checkin__hotspot= Hotspot and hotspot__business= Business

hotspots_visited(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get all of the hotspots the user has visited, optionally filtering by business
